cite: Sokol-Hessner, P., Hsu, M., Curley, N. G., Delgado, M. R., Camerer, C. F., Phelps, E. A., & Smith, E. E. (2009). Thinking like a Trader Selectively Reduces Individuals' Loss Aversion. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America, 106(13), 5035-5040. http://www.pnas.org/content/106/13/5035

data_columns.subjID: A unique identifier for each subject in the data-set.
data_columns.gain: Possible (50\%) gain outcome of a risky option (e.g. 9).}
data_columns.loss: Possible (50\%) loss outcome of a risky option (e.g. 5, or -5).
data_columns.cert: Guaranteed amount of a safe option. "cert" is assumed to be zero or greater than zero.
data_columns.gamble: If gamble was taken, gamble == 1; else gamble == 0.
